incidents.name: DNS Record and Wildcard Cert Issue Delays

incident_updates.body:
Our upstream provider is currently under maintenance which impacts the following operations:
- Delay in wildcard TLS cert issuance
- Delay in updating DNS records
- Delay in domain assignment for new KV databases

incidents.name: Deployment logs not available for some customers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented, and we are monitoring the results. Additionally, we are actively processing backlogged logs.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating deployment logs not being available for some customers.

incidents.name: Elevated Build Errors with Edge Functions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream provider has resolved their incident, and our builds are no longer degraded. We are continuing to monitor.

Our team has identified an issue with an upstream provider causing elevated build errors for builds containing edge functions. The estimated time for recovery is ~2 hours. We will provide updates as soon as they become available.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is underway.

Blob stores can be created and files uploaded. Blob downloads, however, are experiencing some issues and we are currently investigating it.

Existing Blob stores created before November 2, 2023 14:00 UTC are working as normal and remain unaffected.
All systems normal.

GitHub has applied a fix for the earlier problem. Vercel for GitHub is no longer experiencing delayed deployments as a result of this. We are continuing to monitor. For more information, see the GitHub status: https://www.githubstatus.com/

We are currently experiencing delayed deployments made with Vercel for GitHub due to problems upstream with GitHub webhooks. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. For more information, please see the GitHub status updates: https://www.githubstatus.com/
This incident has been resolved.
Edge Config update propagation delays have largely resolved and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified. We are still working with our upstream provider to resolve this.
The issue has been identified. We are still working with our upstream provider to resolve this.
The issue has been identified and we are working with our upstream provider to resolve the issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating an issue with edge config updates being delayed.
This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream provider is rolling out a fix. We are continuing to monitor the results
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating elevated EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_TIMEOUT errors. We are working with our upstream provider to resolve this. We will provide updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Increased error rate when creating Edge Functions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We are continuing to investigate Edge Config delays separately. For updates on that issue, subscribe here: https://www.vercel-status.com/incidents/2258cblmqhkd
New deployments are building and operational. Edge Functions are still experiencing delays. We will continue to monitor and provide further updates.
A fix has been implemented by our upstream provider and weâ€™re continuing to monitor the results.
We are continuing to closely monitor the situation with our upstream provider. We are seeing preliminary recovery and will provide further updates as soon as possible.
We're still actively monitoring the situation with our upstream provider and will provide updates as soon as possible.
We are continuing to work with our upstream providers towards a mitigation.
We are continuing to work with our upstream providers towards a mitigation.
We identified the root cause as an issue with one of our upstream providers and working with them towards mitigation.

We are currently investigating elevated errors when creating Edge Functions, new Blob stores, and for propagation for Edge Config updates. We are working with our upstream provider to resolve this. We will provide updates as soon as they become available.
This incident has been resolved.
Services have been restored and builds are no longer degraded. We are continuing to monitor.

We are currently seeing an increase in build failures due to an outage of the npm package registry. Please follow along for updates on their incident here: https://status.npmjs.org/incidents/zdznxkrp22py

Additionally, we are experiencing intermittent errors in edge function deployments. 

Our team is continuing to investigate.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have implemented a fix to mitigate issues with case creation via our Support Center. We continue to monitor.
We are working to mitigate issues with case creation via our Support Center. In the meantime, visit https://vercel.com/guides/how-to-get-vercel-support for alternate ways to get support from Vercel.

We are currently experiencing issues with case creation via our Support Center. In the meantime, visit https://vercel.com/guides/how-to-get-vercel-support for alternate ways to get support from Vercel.
This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream provider, Neon, has resolved the issue and their service has now recovered. They are monitoring the situation.
Our upstream provider Neon has identified the cause of the issue and working to resolve it.

Our upstream provider, Neon, is currently experiencing technical issues that affects Postgres database operations in all regions. Neon is working to resolve these issues and restore normal operations.

All systems normal; our upstream provider, Neon, has resolved the issue and their service has now recovered.

incidents.name: Function Execution Issue Causing Infinite Loading

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Our team has identified an issue with some function executions, which began between 2023-10-03 18:00 and 2023-10-04 01:30 UTC, that are causing an infinite loading issue for a portion of our customers. A fix has been identified and is currently being rolled out.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented, and as of 18:03 UTC, we are no longer seeing build errors. We are continuing to monitor the results.
A portion of builds are currently experiencing failures due to a recent release. We've identified the issue and are working towards a solution.
From from 00:21 UTC to 00:47 UTC we experienced elevated Build Queue time. The issue is now resolved and Builds are completing as expected.
This incident has been resolved. We will continue to monitor the results.
A new fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are still investigating this issue and a new fix is being implemented.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an issue with builds stuck in a queued state.

incidents.name: Elevated HTTP 500 Errors: [ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED]: Package subpath './server.edge' is not defined by "exports"

incident_updates.body:
Some customer deployments between 2023-09-21 20:33 UTC and 2023-09-22 0953 UTC saw runtime errors in serverless functions.

Impact:
Any build that used Next.js versions between v13.4.3 and v13.5.1 would have produced the runtime error in serverless functions while the build container was deployed.

Impacted customers should redeploy.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates with SAML Authentication

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're pleased to report that our upstream provider has addressed this issue. We will continue to closely monitor the situation and will provide additional updates if necessary.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are investigating elevated SAML authentication errors, where users are prompted with a "This web property is not accessible via this address." error. We have identified that the root cause is linked to an issue with an upstream provider.

Please note that existing tokens and sessions are not impacted and continue to function normally. We are actively collaborating with our upstream provider to resolve the issue. We will provide updates as more information becomes available.

Due to a problem with GitHub, some commits pushed to GitHub between 01:45 and 02:15 UTC might have trouble being deployed. Deployments from other Git providers and CLI are not affected. Affected customers may want to push again to trigger a build. For more information, see the GitHub status "Incident with Actions, Pull Requests and Webhooks": https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/spz29wshw9mh

On 8/25/23, between the time of 15:15 UTC and 15:51 UTC, Vercel experienced downtime with our runtime logs due to a connection loss with our upstream provider. During that time, users would have been unable to access and view their logs within their Vercel dashboard.

The service was restored at 15:51 UTC on 08/25 with no data loss observed.
This incident has been resolved. Any failed builds will need to be manually re-run and will not be retried automatically.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating a percentage of builds failing with the error "Client network socket disconnected before secure TLS connection was established".

incidents.name: GitHub Login Issues Due to Rate Limit Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Rate limiting has stopped and GitHub login should work as normal again. We will continue monitoring for any issues.

A portion of our customers who have deployed serverless functions using a Vercel team between July 17th (12:30p UTC) and July 18th (8:54p UTC) could be experiencing truncated HTML content when their server renders on Vercel. A fix has been released. The issue has been mitigated, but people may have apps deployed with a bad version. Please redeploy your project to have the fix included.
This incident has been resolved.
We are no longer observing a degradation in DNS updates. This is due to the upstream problems with our DNS provider being resolved. We are continuing to monitor.
We are observing a degradation in DNS updates due to an ongoing issue with our upstream provider. Existing DNS records are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.
